text: You are not a drop in the ocean. You are the entire ocean in a drop.
author: Rumi

text: This too shall pass.
author: Persian Proverb

text: You don't have to control your thoughts. You just have to stop letting them control you.
author: Dan Millman

text: The greatest weapon against stress is our ability to choose one thought over another.
author: William James

text: Take time to do what makes your soul happy.
author: Unknown

text: You, yourself, as much as anybody in the entire universe, deserve your love and affection.
author: Buddha

text: Out of suffering have emerged the strongest souls; the most massive characters are seared with scars.
author: Kahlil Gibran

text: If you want to fly, give up everything that weighs you down.
author: Buddha

text: You don’t have to see the whole staircase, just take the first step.
author: Martin Luther King Jr.

text: It’s okay to struggle. It’s not okay to give up.
author: Unknown

text: Healing takes courage, and we all have courage, even if we have to dig a little to find it.
author: Tori Amos

text: The best way out is always through.
author: Robert Frost

text: Life doesn’t get easier or more forgiving, we get stronger and more resilient.
author: Steve Maraboli

text: Sometimes the smallest step in the right direction ends up being the biggest step of your life.
author: Naeem Callaway

text: Courage doesn’t happen when you have all the answers. It happens when you are ready to face the questions.
author: Shannon L. Alder

text: You don’t have to control your thoughts. You just have to stop letting them control you.
author: Dan Millman

text: One small crack does not mean that you are broken; it means that you were put to the test and you didn’t fall apart.
author: Linda Poindexter

text: Your present circumstances don’t determine where you can go; they merely determine where you start.
author: Nido Qubein

text: Start where you are. Use what you have. Do what you can.
author: Arthur Ashe

text: Happiness can be found even in the darkest of times if one only remembers to turn on the light.
author: Albus Dumbledore

text: Healing is an art. It takes time, it takes practice, it takes love.
author: Maza Dohta

text: You are allowed to be both a masterpiece and a work in progress simultaneously.
author: Sophia Bush

text: You don’t have to have it all figured out to move forward.
author: Unknown

text: The only journey is the one within.
author: Rainer Maria Rilke

text: Sometimes when you’re in a dark place you think you’ve been buried, but actually you’ve been planted.
author: Christine Caine

text: Be gentle with yourself. You’re doing the best you can.
author: Unknown

text: You are more than your mistakes. You are more than your past.
author: Unknown

text: Everything you need to heal is within you.
author: Unknown

text: The wound is the place where the light enters you.
author: Rumi

text: Your mental health is a priority. Your happiness is an essential. Your self-care is a necessity.
author: Unknown

text: Growth is painful. Change is painful. But nothing is as painful as staying stuck somewhere you don’t belong.
author: Unknown

text: One day you will tell your story of how you overcame what you went through, and it will be someone else’s survival guide.
author: Brene Brown

text: You are not alone in this, and you are not strange for feeling the way you do.
author: Unknown

text: Sometimes the people around you won’t understand your journey. They don’t need to; it’s not for them.
author: Joubert Botha

text: When you can’t control what’s happening, challenge yourself to control the way you respond to what’s happening.
author: Unknown

text: Give yourself permission to unplug and regroup, without feeling guilty. You can’t be there for others if you don’t take care of yourself first.
author: Unknown

text: The strongest people are not those who show strength in front of us but those who win battles we know nothing about.
author: Unknown

text: Don’t believe everything you think.
author: Unknown

text: Self-care is how you take your power back.
author: Lalah Delia

text: You’re braver than you believe, and stronger than you seem, and smarter than you think.
author: A.A. Milne

text: You can’t go back and change the beginning, but you can start where you are and change the ending.
author: C.S. Lewis

text: Every day may not be good... but there’s something good in every day.
author: Alice Morse Earle

text: Sometimes you have to stop thinking so much and just go where your heart takes you.
author: Unknown

text: You don’t have to be positive all the time. It’s perfectly okay to feel sad, angry, annoyed, frustrated, scared, and anxious.
author: Unknown

text: The only way out is through.
author: Robert Frost

text: Let go of who you think you’re supposed to be; embrace who you are.
author: Brene Brown

text: Don’t let yesterday take up too much of today.
author: Will Rogers

text: You don’t have to have it all figured out to move forward.
author: Unknown

text: What lies behind us and what lies before us are tiny matters compared to what lies within us.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

text: Just when the caterpillar thought the world was over, it became a butterfly.
author: Proverb

text: Be kind to yourself right now.
author: Unknown

text: The only way to make sense out of change is to plunge into it, move with it, and join the dance.
author: Alan Watts

text: Don’t wait for everything to be perfect before you decide to enjoy your life.
author: Joyce Meyer

text: Your mind will always believe everything you tell it. Feed it faith. Feed it truth. Feed it with love.
author: Unknown

text: Sometimes you need to take a break from everyone and spend time alone to experience, appreciate, and love yourself.
author: Robert Tew

text: Never let the fear of striking out keep you from playing the game.
author: Babe Ruth

text: This is not the end of your story.
author: Unknown

text: You don’t have to be perfect to be amazing.
author: Unknown

text: Never underestimate the power you have to take your life in a new direction.
author: Germany Kent

text: You are never too old to set another goal or to dream a new dream.
author: C.S. Lewis

text: Keep looking up… that’s the secret of life.
author: Charlie Brown

text: A champion is defined not by their wins but by how they can recover when they fall.
author: Serena Williams

text: Make time to do what makes your soul happy.
author: Unknown

text: Healing doesn’t mean the damage never existed. It means the damage no longer controls our lives.
author: Unknown

text: Your calm mind is the ultimate weapon against your challenges. So relax.
author: Bryant McGill

text: Fall seven times, stand up eight.
author: Japanese Proverb

text: Self-care is giving the world the best of you, instead of what’s left of you.
author: Katie Reed

text: One day, in retrospect, the years of struggle will strike you as the most beautiful.
author: Sigmund Freud

text: You are stronger than you think.
author: Unknown

text: Nothing can dim the light that shines from within.
author: Maya Angelou

text: You’re allowed to be a masterpiece and a work in progress at the same time.
author: Sophia Bush

text: When we give ourselves compassion, we are opening our hearts in a way that can transform our lives.
author: Kristin Neff

text: Your illness does not define you. Your strength and courage does.
author: Unknown

text: You are not a drop in the ocean. You are the entire ocean in a drop.
author: Rumi

author: Persian Proverb

author: Sophia Bush

text: When we give ourselves compassion, we are opening our hearts in a way that can transform our lives.
author: Kristin Neff

text: Your illness does not define you. Your strength and courage does.
author: Unknown

text: Keep moving forward!
author: Walt Disney

text: The flower that blooms in adversity is the most rare and beautiful of all.
author: Mulan

text: Venture outside your comfort zone. The rewards are worth it.
author: Rapunzel, Tangled

text: You are braver than you believe, stronger than you seem, and smarter than you think.
author: Christopher Robin, Winnie the Pooh

text: The past can hurt. But the way I see it, you can either run from it or learn from it.
author: Rafiki, The Lion King

text: Oh yes, the past can hurt. But you can either run from it, or learn from it.
author: Rafiki, The Lion King

text: Just keep swimming.
author: Dory, Finding Nemo

text: A true hero isn’t measured by the size of his strength, but by the strength of his heart.
author: Zeus, Hercules

text: Even miracles take a little time.
author: Fairy Godmother, Cinderella

text: Remember, you’re the one who can fill the world with sunshine.
author: Snow White

text: The only way to get what you want in this world is through hard work.
author: Tiana, The Princess and the Frog

text: If watching is all you're going to do, then you're going to watch your life go by without you.
author: Laverne, The Hunchback of Notre Dame

text: You control your destiny. You don’t need magic to do it. And there are no magical shortcuts to solving your problems.
author: Merida, Brave

text: A little consideration, a little thought for others, makes all the difference.
author: Eeyore, Winnie the Pooh

text: Sometimes the right path is not the easiest one.
author: Grandmother Willow, Pocahontas

text: You're never too old to be young.
author: Snow White and the Seven Dwarfs

text: Our fate lives within us; you only have to be brave enough to see it.
author: Merida, Brave

text: All it takes is faith and trust.
author: Peter Pan

text: Let your conscience be your guide.
author: Pinocchio

text: Life is a journey to be experienced, not a problem to be solved.
author: Winnie the Pooh

text: The things that make me different are the things that make me, me.
author: Piglet, Winnie the Pooh
